item.title: Item command 317
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

if (args[0].equals("spawn")) {
    if (args[1].equals("item")) {
        if (player.getUsername().equals("your username")) {
            int id = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
            int amount = 1;
            if (args.length == 4) {
                amount = Integer.parseInt(args[3]);
            }
            Item item = new Item(id, amount);
            player.getInventory().add(item);
            player.updateItems();
        }
    }
}
// ...
else {
    sendMessage(player, "Unknown command: " + args[0]);
}

Although, It would probably be a wise choice to use some OOP techniques.

Read full topic

item.title: Item command 317
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well that’s simple here is the regular command

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 20500 && newItemID >= 0) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);

            }[/code]

you see the part were it says this “if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {” just take out the ) so its (“item”) { and between the bracket and the ) add && c.playerRights >=3)
so it’d look like this

you can change the 3 to 2 or 1 and if its )) then it’s for all players
3 is owner
2 is admin
1 is mod
Hope this helped

and if you want it to be just for you it, you would change it to this

no need to add the player rights because it only works for that username
rep ++ if it helped you understand more about the commands. Also, if you have anymore questions about the commands, feel free to ask me.

Read full topic

try {

if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);

c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
